title: Cesaro Curve
description: An interactive MicroSim demonstrating the Cesaro curve fractal (torn square) with adjustable recursion depth and size controls.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics
Geometry
Fractals
learningObjectives: Understand how angle choices affect fractal appearance
Observe the relationship between recursion depth and pattern complexity
Explore how simple rules create complex, beautiful patterns

controls.name: recursionSlider
controls.label: Recursion Level
controls.description: Controls the depth of fractal recursion. Higher values create more detailed, lace-like patterns.

controls.name: sizeSlider
controls.label: Size
controls.description: Adjusts the overall size of the curve within the canvas.

equations: Number of segments at level n: S(n) = 4 * 2^(n-1)
limitations: Maximum recursion level of 10 to prevent performance issues
Bend angle is fixed (not adjustable in this version)
